title: Eskom Operational Recovery Directive
description: Directive requiring Eskom to implement an accelerated plant maintenance programme to reduce unplanned outages and curtail load shedding below Stage 4 by end of FY2023.
notes: Load shedding ended March 2024 ahead of directive timeline. EAF improved from 58% to 65.8%.

title: Eskom Debt Restructuring Implementation Directive
description: Directive to implement the R254bn government debt relief programme in three tranches over FY2023-FY2025, subject to performance conditions including tariff cost-reflectivity.
notes: FY2023 tranche of R70bn transferred. FY2024 tranche of R84bn confirmed in Budget. FY2025 R100bn tranche pending.

title: Eskom Transmission Unbundling Directive
description: Directive to establish National Transmission Company of South Africa (NTCSA) as a separate entity in terms of the Electricity Regulation Amendment Act by 31 December 2024.
notes: NTCSA registered as separate entity July 2024. Staff and asset transfer ongoing.

title: SAA Business Rescue Conclusion and Relaunch Directive
description: Directive to conclude business rescue proceedings and relaunch SAA as a restructured, commercially viable airline with reduced cost base. Government equity injection of R10.5bn approved.
notes: Business rescue concluded April 2021. SAA relaunched 23 September 2021. Directive objectives achieved.

title: SAA Strategic Equity Partner Process Directive
description: Directive requiring SAA to conduct a competitive process to attract a Strategic Equity Partner (SEP) to provide long-term commercial and operational support.
notes: Expressions of interest received. Shortlisting process underway. Decision expected Q2 2025.

title: SAA Fleet Rejuvenation Approval Directive
description: Ministerial approval in terms of PFMA Section 54 for SAA to proceed with acquisition of 10 Airbus A320neo aircraft under the Fleet Rejuvenation Programme, valued at R12bn.
notes: Aircraft orders placed. Delivery commencing Q2 2026 subject to Airbus production schedule.

title: Transnet Port Efficiency Improvement Directive
description: Directive requiring Transnet to implement urgent measures to reduce Port of Durban container dwell times from 9.4 days to under 4 days within 18 months. KPIs established for Ports Regulator oversight.
issuingAuthority: Department of Public Enterprises / Department of Transport
notes: Dwell times reduced to 5.2 days by January 2024. Recovery Plan maintained ongoing improvements.

title: Transnet Rail Crime Reduction Directive
description: Directive requiring Transnet to implement a comprehensive rail crime prevention programme in partnership with SAPS and SANDF, targeting 50% reduction in cable theft within 24 months.
notes: SAPS Railway Police strengthened. Military deployment on Northern Cape corridor. Some improvement but Northern Cape incidents escalated Q3 2024.

title: Transnet Third Party Rail Access Framework Directive
description: Directive to develop and implement a third-party rail access framework to allow private freight operators onto the Transnet network in accordance with the Rail Policy and competition reform objectives.
issuingAuthority: Department of Transport and Logistics / DPE
notes: Policy framework in draft. Legal review underway. Pilot programme on coal corridor planned for H1 2025.

title: Denel Financial Stabilisation Directive
description: Directive requiring Denel to address immediate salary arrears, stabilise cash flow through asset optimisation and implement cost-reduction measures. Government funding of R3bn conditionally approved.
issuingAuthority: Department of Public Enterprises / National Treasury
notes: R3bn emergency funding released. Salary arrears cleared. Interim stabilisation achieved by Q1 2022.

title: Denel Turnaround Plan Adoption Directive
description: Directive requiring Denel Board to adopt and implement a formal 5-year Turnaround Plan addressing financial sustainability, international partnerships, pension deficit and skills retention.
notes: Turnaround Plan adopted August 2022. Phase 1 completed December 2023. Phase 2 commenced January 2024.

title: SOE Irregular Expenditure Consequence Management Directive
description: Treasury directive requiring all SOEs to implement consequence management processes for all irregular and wasteful expenditure identified in AGSA audit findings within 60 days of audit conclusion.
notes: Eskom and Transnet have active consequence management processes. Denel compliance improving. SAA implementing.

title: Transnet Perishables Export Corridor Priority Directive
description: Directive to prioritise perishables handling at Cape Town and Port Elizabeth ports to protect South Africa's R15bn fresh fruit export industry from logistics delays.
issuingAuthority: Department of Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development
notes: Dedicated reefer facilities expanded at Cape Town. Priority loading protocol implemented. Export season 2024 on track.

title: SOE Board Composition and Governance Directive
description: Treasury directive prescribing minimum governance standards for SOE boards including board size, independent director composition, committee structures and director independence criteria.
notes: All four SOEs have achieved compliant board compositions. Eskom board refreshed with new appointments in early 2024.

title: Eskom Just Energy Transition Plan Implementation Directive
description: Directive requiring Eskom to develop and implement a Just Energy Transition (JET) plan for coal power station decommissioning, including worker and community transition programmes, aligned to the JET Investment Plan.
notes: Komati Power Station decommissioned October 2022. JET plans for Camden and Hendrina being developed.

title: Eskom Coal Procurement Reform Directive
description: Directive to reform Eskom coal procurement through long-term supply agreements, spot purchase limitations and emergency procurement protocols to prevent supply disruptions.
notes: Emergency spot purchase protocol approved. 80% of coal supply under long-term agreements by December 2023.

title: SOE Performance Shareholder Compact Directive
description: Directive prescribing standardised Shareholder Compact format and KPIs for all major SOEs, to be signed annually between each SOE board and DPE Minister.
responsibleOfficer: All SOE CEOs and DPE Minister
notes: FY2024/25 Shareholder Compacts signed for all four SOEs by April 2024.

title: SAA Minimum Fleet Age Compliance Directive
description: SACAA directive requiring SAA to reduce average fleet age to below 15 years by 2026 and replace aircraft older than 20 years by end 2025 to maintain safety certification.
responsibleOfficer: SAA Chief Safety Officer and CEO
notes: 3 aircraft over 20 years to be phased out by end 2025. Fleet rejuvenation programme addresses this requirement.

title: Transnet New Locomotive Programme Delivery Acceleration Directive
description: Directive to resolve contractual disputes with CRRC and ensure delivery of remaining 500 locomotives from the 1,064 unit order is accelerated and local content obligations are met.
notes: 624 of 1064 locomotives delivered by October 2024. Dispute on local content resolved. Delivery on revised schedule.

title: Denel SANDF Ammunition Priority Supply Directive
description: Ministerial directive requiring Denel to prioritise SANDF ammunition supply contracts above all other orders during periods of national security requirements.
notes: SANDF quarterly ammunition requirements being met. Priority allocation system implemented in production planning.

title: SOE Supply Chain Anti-Corruption Directive
description: Treasury directive requiring all SOEs to implement enhanced supply chain management controls, declare conflicts of interest, and report all awards above R5m to Treasury and DPE quarterly.
responsibleOfficer: All SOE CFOs and Chief Procurement Officers
notes: Quarterly disclosure reports submitted. Eskom and Transnet noted legacy State Capture related contracts being terminated.

title: Eskom Air Quality Compliance Directive
description: Directive requiring Eskom to submit a revised Air Quality Compliance Plan for all 15 coal power stations, with firm deadlines for FGD (flue gas desulphurisation) retrofitting or station closure.
issuingAuthority: Department of Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment
notes: FGD retrofitting planned for Medupi and Kusile. Variance applications submitted for older stations pending decommissioning timelines.

title: SAA Route Network Minimum Service Level Directive
description: Directive prescribing minimum domestic route frequencies SAA must maintain as a national carrier on JNB-CPT, JNB-DUR and CPT-GRJ corridors.
issuingAuthority: Department of Public Enterprises / Department of Transport
notes: Minimum frequencies maintained. JNB-CPT 6 daily, JNB-DUR 4 daily, CPT-GRJ 2 daily.

title: Denel International Export Compliance Directive
description: Directive requiring Denel to ensure all defence exports comply with the National Conventional Arms Control Committee (NCACC) requirements and end-user certificates are obtained for all international transactions.
notes: Rooivalk and LMT export permits obtained. Compliance officer appointed. NCACC reporting on schedule.

title: SOE Borrowing Programme Approval Directive
description: Treasury directive requiring all SOE borrowing above R5bn to obtain prior written ministerial approval and submit quarterly debt management reports to National Treasury.
notes: Quarterly debt reports submitted to NT. Eskom borrowing approval obtained for R42bn bond programme. Transnet R28bn approval confirmed.

title: Eskom Emergency Power Purchase Agreement Directive
description: NERSA directive enabling Eskom to procure emergency power from licensed IPPs above 100MW under fast-track PPAs to address immediate generation shortfalls.
notes: Fast-track PPAs signed with 5 IPPs totalling 2,400MW. Grid connection completed for 1,800MW by end 2024.
